TEXT.English: Display popup on initialization indicating what components are active
TEXT.Spanish: Muestra un popup en la inicialización indicando que componentes hay activos.
No cambies esto

TEXT.English: Turn on Barbarian Civ Debug output
TEXT.Spanish: Activa la salida de depuración del mod Barbarian Civ.
Anuncia Asentamiento Bárbaro

TEXT.English: Enables announcment when Barbarian cities settle down and spawn new civs
TEXT.Spanish: Activa el anuncio cuando una ciudad bárbara se asienta y forma una nueva civilización.
Popup Asentamiento Bárbaro

TEXT.English: Use a popup when announcing barbarian city settleing
TEXT.Spanish: Muestra un popup anunciando que una ciudad bárbara se asienta y forma una nueva civilización.
Notificar jugadores cercanos

TEXT.English: Only nearby players are notified when barbarian cities settle
TEXT.Spanish: Solo los jugadores cercanos son notificados cuando una ciudad bárbara se asienta.
No Popup en automático

TEXT.English: Lock barb settle popup while AIAutoPlay is on (will show up as messages)
TEXT.Spanish: Bloquea el popup de asentamiento bárbaro cuando AIAutoPlay esta activado (solo se mostrara el mensaje)
Política de Nuevo Mundo

TEXT.English: Sets New World policy on Barbarian civ settling in new world landmasses[NEWLINE]0: New World treated like Old World[NEWLINE]1: New World barb civs spawn as normal, but chance to settle into a full civ from a minor is reduced[NEWLINE]2: New World barbarian civs stay minors until contact is made with an old world civ[NEWLINE]3: Like 2, but New World barb civs cannot settle until an Old World unit lands on the landmass[NEWLINE]4: Barb civs will not spawn until an old world civ unit lands on landmass[NEWLINE]5: Barb civs will not spawn until an old world civ settles a city on the landmass
TEXT.Spanish: Establece la Política de Nuevo Mundo sobre las civilizaciones bárbaras asentándose en territorios 'Nuevo Mundo'[NEWLINE]0: Nuevo Mundo tratado como Viejo Mundo[NEWLINE]1: Las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo aparecen normalmente, pero la probabilidad de crecer a una civilización completa es reducida[NEWLINE]2: Las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo permanecen como civilizaciones menores hasta el contacto con las civilizaciones del Viejo Mundo[NEWLINE]3: Como el punto 2, pero las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo no pueden pasar de menores hasta que una unidad del Viejo Mundo pisa la tierra[NEWLINE]4: Las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo no crecerán a civilización menor hasta que una unidad del Viejo Mundo pisa la tierra[NEWLINE]5: Las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo no crecerán a civilización menor hasta que una civilización del Viejo Mundo funda una ciudad en el territorio
Vida Media Civ. Menor

TEXT.English: Average number of turns a new world minor civ remains a minor after the conditions under NewWorldPolicies 2 and higher are satisfied
TEXT.Spanish: Numero de turnos medio en que una civilización menor permanece menor después de que las condiciones de Política de Nuevo Mundo 2 y superiores se han cumplido
Nativos Agresivos

TEXT.English: New World barbcivs will attack Old World civs preferentially and in addition to wars against other new world civs
TEXT.Spanish: Las civilizaciones bárbaras del Nuevo Mundo atacaran a las del Viejo Mundo preferiblemente y además de las guerras que tuvieran con otras civilizaciones del Nuevo Mundo
Ofrecer Control

TEXT.English: Offer player control of new barb civilizations
TEXT.Spanish: Ofrece al jugador tomar el control de las nuevas civilizaciones bárbaras
Cancelar Ofrecer Control

TEXT.English: Cancels player control of new barb civilizations
TEXT.Spanish: Cancela la toma de control de las nuevas civilizaciones bárbaras por el jugador
Estilo Civ. Bárbaras

TEXT.English: If a city has culture, spawn a new civ with same art style as highest culture player
TEXT.Spanish: Si una ciudad tiene cultura, genera una nueva civilización bárbaras con el mismo estilo artístico que el jugador con la cultura más elevada.
Maximo de Civ. Bárbaras

TEXT.English: Barbcivs will not spawn if there are already this many civs in the game (-1 for DLL limit)
TEXT.Spanish: Las Civ. Bárbaras no se asentaran si ya hay este número de civilizaciones en el juego (-1 del límite DLL)
Modificador Creacion Civ. Menor

TEXT.English: Change odds of barb city turning into a minor civ)
TEXT.French: Change odds of barb city turning into a minor civ
TEXT.German: Change odds of barb city turning into a minor civ
TEXT.Italian: Change odds of barb city turning into a minor civ
TEXT.Spanish: Cambia las probabilidades de que una ciudad bárbara se convierta en Civ. Menor.
TEXT.Finnish: Change odds of barb city turning into a minor civ

TEXT.Spanish: Mínima Población Ciudad Bárbara

TEXT.English: Minimum population needed for a barb city to settle
TEXT.Spanish: Mínimo de población necesario para una ciudad bárbara se asiente.
Mínimo Contactos

TEXT.English: Minimum number of contacts (with any civ) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ
TEXT.French: Minimum number of contacts (with any civs) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ
TEXT.German: Minimum number of contacts (with any civs) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ
TEXT.Italian: Minimum number of contacts (with any civs) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ
TEXT.Spanish: Número mínimo de contactos (con cualquier Civ.) que una Civilización Bárbara menor necesita para convertirse en una Civilización Completa.
TEXT.Finnish: Minimum number of contacts (with any civs) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ

TEXT.Spanish: Mínimo Contactos Completos

TEXT.English: Minimum number of contacts (with full civs) a Barbarian Civ needs to settle from a minor to full civ
TEXT.Spanish: Número mínimo de contactos (con Civ. Completas) que una Civilización Bárbara menor necesita para convertirse en una Civilización Completa.
Probabilidades Militares

TEXT.English: Base odds of Military style buildup
TEXT.Spanish: Probabilidades base del estilo 'Incremento en la Fuerza Militar'
Fracción Tecnología Bárbara

TEXT.English: Former barbarians get all techs known by this fraction of players
TEXT.Spanish: Las nuevas civilizaciones bárbaras obtienen todas las tecnologías conocidas por este número de jugadores
Reducción Nuevo Mundo

TEXT.English: Reduce tech given to former barbarians alone on a continent (larger means they're more behind)
TEXT.Spanish: Reduce las tecnologías obtenidas por las nuevas civilizaciones bárbaras que estén solas en un continente (Valor elevado significa que obtienen menos tecnologías)
Atraso Eras Nuevo Mundo

TEXT.English: Eras behind New World BarbCivs will be before allowed to spawn

TEXT.Spanish: Bonus Tecnologías Diligente

TEXT.English: Number of bonus techs that builder type BarbCivs get
TEXT.Spanish: Numero de tecnologías de bonus que obtienen las civilizaciones bárbaras de tipo Diligente.
Declarar Guerra

TEXT.English: After settling into a full civ from a minor, militaristic barb civ will declare war on the first civ it meets within this window of turns
TEXT.Spanish: Después de asentarse como una civilización completa, las civilizaciones Agresivas declararan la guerra a la primera civilización que se encuentren dentro de esta ventana de turnos.
Distancia Máxima Declaración

TEXT.English: Max Distance between capitals for barb civ to consider immeadiate declaration of war (must also be on same continent)
TEXT.Spanish: Máxima distancia entre capitales para que una civilización bárbara considere la declaración de guerra inmediata (Debe estar en el mismo continente).
Multiplicador Bonus Unidades

TEXT.English: Affects number of (non-defense) military units given to barbs
TEXT.Spanish: Afecta al número de (no defensivas) unidades militares otorgadas a los barbaros.

TEXT.English: Bonuses given to barbarian civs that spawn in the new world.[NEWLINE]0: None - New world barb civs recieve no bonus techs, units or buildings when spawned or settled[NEWLINE]1: Reduced - New World barb civs recieve all techs known by the barbarians, and recieve some culture and free units[NEWLINE]2: Barbarian civs in the new world are treated the same as barbarian civs that spawn in the Old World
Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy.
TEXT.French: Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy
TEXT.German: Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy
TEXT.Italian: Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy
TEXT.Spanish: Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy
TEXT.Finnish: Minimum turns a new created barb civ must remain a minor civ, before it can settle and engage in diplomacy

TEXT.English: Revolution Debug information displayed and debug information logging.
Revolution Message Pop Ups are centered.
Enables special RevIndex pop up (debugging info)
Max Score Lines displayed on Scoreboard (-1 for Maximum)
Spawn Rebels with a preference for the artstyle type of the parent nation
Offer human players with a rebelion the choice to defect and lead the rebels.
Small revolutions spawn as disorganized rebels (barbarians)
Allow Revolutions to break Vassal states
When a rebel civ dies, current wars are cancelled (in case of respawn)
Allow Human Player to have Leader changing Revolutions
Nationality percentage cap in a city above which a city will cease to be effected by nationality based revolutions.
Limiting distance for colony negative revolutionary effects, and distance rebeling cities can effect and draw in other cities.
Allows cities with state religion to join Religious Rebellions.
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx changes
Offset used to alter RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx changes for Human Players
Offset used to alter RevIdx changes for Human Players
Multiplier used to alter chance of spawning a revolution
Multiplier used to alter initial Rebellion Strength
Multiplier used to alter revolutionary reinforcement strength
Multiplier used to alter Happiness based RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter Colony based RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter Distance to Capital RevIdx penalty
Multiplier used to alter Culture Rate RevIdx bonus
Multiplier used to alter Nationality based RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx bonus from city garrison
Multiplier used to alter Religion based RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter Civ Size based RevIdx changes
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx penalty from loosing a city
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx bonus from conquering a city
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx bonus from Culture in a city
Odds used to determine Revolution type when a rebellion occurs, adjusts chance of Civics type rebellion
Odds used to determine Revolution type when a rebellion occurs, adjusts chance of Religious type rebellion
Odds used to determine Revolution type when a rebellion occurs, adjusts chance of Leader type rebellion
Odds used to determine Revolution type when a rebellion occurs, adjusts chance of Crusade type rebellion
Odds used to determine Revolution type when a rebellion occurs, adjusts chance of Independence type rebellion
Fraction of RevIdx used to warn a Human Player of an indpending Revolutionary issue in a city (1.0 equates to a RevIdx of 1000)
Mininum number of turns waited before repeating an inpending revolution warning
Multiplier used to alter RevIdx penalty caused by War Weariness
Maximum number for Players allowed in a game before Revolutions cease to occur (-1 for Maximum Players allowed by Engine)
Minimum number of turns that must pass before a city that has already rebelled can spawn new revolution
Minimum number of turns that must pass before a revolution can be spawned after accepting rebel demands
Minimum number of turns that must pass before a recently conquered city may spawn a revolution
Minimum number of turns that must pass before a revolution can occur after rebels have been bought off
Average number of turns that pass before rebellions recieve reinforcements
Minumum number of turns that must pass between reinforcements
RevIdx value at which a city that causes a rebellion will always be a violent and spawn rebel units
RevIdx value at which a city can instigate rebellions
Fraction of RevIdx Instigate Threshold at which a city may join an instigating city's rebellion
TEXT.Finnish: RevIdx value at which a city can instigate rebellions

TEXT.English: Effects local RevIdx effects and bribing, as well as penalties added when a city is feeling rebelious
Turns delay before a new rebellion can spawn, or rebels can make new demands, after rebel terms are rejected
Blocks pop ups while in AIAutoplay
Refortifies units when human takes control from AIAutoplay
Stop AIAutoplay when somebody wins the game
Stop AIAutoplay when a revolution occurs
Enables Debugging information and logging for Change Player functions
Enables Debugging information and logging for Tech Diffusion functions
Minimum number of techs a team must be behind before recieving Tech Diffusion bonuses
Number of techs a team must be behind before recieving full Tech Diffusion bonuses
Offset number of techs behind used to give heavy Tech Diffusion bonuses to very behind civs
Modifier used in Tech Diffusion calculations
Enables Debugging information and logging for Dynamic Civ Names
Level of creativity the Dynamic Civ Names component employs to generate names
Dynamic Civ Names applied across teams
Dynamic Civ Names are not applied to human players
Default names of the form "Amurite Empire" are used instead of "Amurites"
Dynamic Civ Names is disabled in multiplayer
